remarks.para: May be inoperative unlocked provided maximum airspeed limit is 225 KIAS or 0.73 Mach, whichever is less.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Do not exceed 225 KIAS or .73 Mach. The 225 KIAS limit will preclude operation using normal VREF+100 flaps up maneuver speed. Sufficient maneuver margin exists at weights lighter than 550,000 to permit operation at VREF+80 for flaps up maneuver speed.
Limit maximum speed to 225 KIAS or 0.73 Mach, whichever is less.
Max takeoff weight is limited to 555,000 lbs.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "OUTB AILERON LOCKOUT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: To check that the outboard ailerons are unlocked, perform the following steps:
Display the flight controls synoptic page to view the position of the outboard ailerons.
Open and collar the P7 panel OUTBD AIL LOCKOUT circuit breaker to ensure outboard ailerons remain unlocked during the flight.
Rotate either control wheel (Captain’s or First Officer’s) to the left and verify that the outboard ailerons move freely.
Rotate either control wheel (Captain’s or First Officer’s) to the right and verify that the outboard ailerons move freely.
Placard near Captain’s and First Officer’s Primary Flight Display - DO NOT EXCEED 225 KIAS OR 0.73 MACH.

graphic.title: OUTBOARD AILERON CONTROL PACKAGE AND LOCKOUT MECHANISM
